title: LLVM crash: Xargo, codegen-units=1, -C panic=unwind, "panic_abort" crate

labels.name: I-crash
labels.description: Issue: The compiler crashes (SIGSEGV, SIGABRT, etc). Use I-ICE instead when the compiler panics.

labels.name: A-LLVM
labels.description: Area: Code generation parts specific to LLVM. Both correctness bugs and optimization-related issues.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Simple Xargo demo:

`src/main.rs`

```rust
fn main() {
    println!("Hello, world!");
}
```

`Cargo.toml`

```toml
[package]
name = "mini"
version = "0.1.0"
authors = ["Vitaly _Vi Shukela <vi0oss@gmail.com>"]
edition = "2018"

[dependencies]
libc = {default-features=false}

[profile.release]
opt-level = "s"
debug = false
rpath = false
lto = true
debug-assertions = false
codegen-units = 2
panic = 'unwind'
```

`Xargo.toml`

```toml
[dependencies]
#panic_unwind = {}
std = {default-features=false, features=["panic-unwind","default"]}
```

Works: builds, runs.

```
$ xargo  run --target=x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu --release
...
Hello, world!
```

Hovewer, if instead specify `codegen-units = 1`, it fails to build:

```
$ xargo  run --target=x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu --release
    Updating crates.io index
   Compiling cc v1.0.27
   Compiling libc v0.2.45
   Compiling core v0.0.0 (/nix/rust/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/src/libcore)
   Compiling unwind v0.0.0 (/nix/rust/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/src/libunwind)
   Compiling build_helper v0.1.0 (/nix/rust/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/src/build_helper)
   Compiling compiler_builtins v0.1.2
   Compiling cmake v0.1.35
   Compiling std v0.0.0 (/nix/rust/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/src/libstd)
   Compiling rustc_asan v0.0.0 (/nix/rust/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/src/librustc_asan)
   Compiling rustc_tsan v0.0.0 (/nix/rust/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/src/librustc_tsan)
   Compiling rustc_lsan v0.0.0 (/nix/rust/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/src/librustc_lsan)
   Compiling rustc_msan v0.0.0 (/nix/rust/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/src/librustc_msan)
   Compiling rustc-std-workspace-core v1.0.0 (/nix/rust/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/src/tools/rustc-std-workspace-core)
   Compiling alloc v0.0.0 (/nix/rust/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/src/liballoc)
   Compiling panic_abort v0.0.0 (/nix/rust/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/src/libpanic_abort)
error: Could not compile `panic_abort`.
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: build failed
error: `"cargo" "build" "--release" "--manifest-path" "/tmp/xargo.zTGYHfkIIUYO/Cargo.toml" "--target" "x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu" "-p" "std"` failed with exit code: Some(101)
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
```

```
$ rustc --version
rustc 1.32.0-nightly (f4a421ee3 2018-12-13)
```

----

Some digging:

```
$ rustc -C codegen-units=2  /nix/rust/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/src/libpanic_abort/lib.rs --crate-type lib --extern libc=/tmp/xargo.6aRd1oJeKVhU/target/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/release/deps/liblibc-20b8be3bd5090c54.rlib -L dependency=/tmp/xargo.6aRd1oJeKVhU/target/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/release/deps   --extern core=/tmp/xargo.6aRd1oJeKVhU/target/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/release/deps/libcore-8cee5fb134ca05cf.rlib --extern compiler_builtins=/tmp/xargo.6aRd1oJeKVhU/target/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/release/deps/libcompiler_builtins-ff2da1c78a40b06f.rlib ; echo $?
0

$ rustc -C codegen-units=1  /nix/rust/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/src/libpanic_abort/lib.rs --crate-type lib --extern libc=/tmp/xargo.6aRd1oJeKVhU/target/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/release/deps/liblibc-20b8be3bd5090c54.rlib -L dependency=/tmp/xargo.6aRd1oJeKVhU/target/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/release/deps   --extern core=/tmp/xargo.6aRd1oJeKVhU/target/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/release/deps/libcore-8cee5fb134ca05cf.rlib --extern compiler_builtins=/tmp/xargo.6aRd1oJeKVhU/target/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/release/deps/libcompiler_builtins-ff2da1c78a40b06f.rlib ; echo $?
1
```

`strace -f rustc ...` shows `SIGSEGV` somewhere when doing `-C codegen-units=1`, but not when doing `-C codegen-units=2`.

Last `RUST_LOG=info` message before exiting in failing case is ` INFO 2018-12-19T22:00:24Z: rustc_codegen_ssa::base: codegen_instance(__rust_maybe_catch_panic)`. The same message is present is successful case, but followed by three more `codegen_instance`s and a final "preparing rlib to".
